alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 4:23PM AKST until December 22 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. Blowing snow along the Kuskokwim Delta coast during the onset of snow could reduce visibilities to as low as one half mile at times. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 9 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A warm front is forecast to advance toward the Kuskokwim Delta this evening. Precipitation preceding the front is expected to fall initially as snow. However, warming temperatures with the front`s passage will support a transition from snow to a mix of freezing rain and sleet from west to east through Tuesday evening. Mixed precipitation is then expected to change to rain from west to east early Wednesday morning as the precipitation begins to taper off.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
